thread.title: A Thinking Person’s Guide to the Rubik’s Cube

author: Eugenia Cheng
title: A Thinking Person’s Guide to the Rubik’s Cube
text:
I have always loved playing with a Rubik’s Cube, which combines logic with a satisfying tactile activity. I can solve it—getting each of the six sides to be one color—but not particularly quickly or cleverly.
The Hungarian sculptor and architect Ernő Rubik invented the cube in 1974, so by now, a couple of generations have passed down tips for solving it. I recently tried to teach my 8-year-old nephew how to solve his 2x2x2 Rubik’s Cube, with four elements on each side. But he already had a curious method of his own, using...
